Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When coming to a pedestrian crossing with a raised traffic island in the middle, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to pedestrians who are on your half of the road
Give way to pedestrians on the other side of the road
Remain stopped until the pedestrian has reached the other side of the road
Drive on as pedestrians will give way to all on coming traffic

Question: What should you do when you are coming up to traffic signals and the signals change from green to yellow?

Answers.Answer: Stop at the signals if you can do so safely
Speed up before the light changes to red
Stop even if it means stopping in the middle of the intersection
Turn hard to the left and stop around the corner

Question: What does ‘the speed limit’ mean?

Answers.Answer: The slowest speed you can drive in good conditions
The fastest speed you can drive in good conditions
The average speed you can drive in good conditions
The fastest speed you can drive, except when overtaking

If you have had a flat tyre and have fitted a ‘space saver wheel’ what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive directly to a place where the flat tyre can be repaired and replaced
Drive at 40km/h until the flat tyre has been repaired
Lower the pressure in the other tyres

Answers.Answer: Lift up the bonnet and boot of your vehicle
Push your vehicle to the nearest off-ramp

Answers.Answer: There is loose gravel on the road that could break your windscreen

Question: When passing a bus displaying a School sign, that has stopped to let children on or off, what should your speed be?

Who may legally require you to give a blood sample?

Answers.Answer: A police officer, an ambulance officer, other crash party
A medical doctor, other crash party, a police officer
A police officer, a medical doctor or an approved person
An ambulance driver, an approved person or a medical doctor

Question: You are driving downhill on a steep, narrow road and a vehicle is coming up the hill. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Pull over to the left and give way to the vehicle coming up the hill
Flash the headlights of your vehicle at the vehicle coming up the hill
Sound the horn of your vehicle to get the vehicle coming up the hill out of the way
Do nothing, the vehicle coming up the hill should give way to you

Question: For the purpose of applying the give way rule, entrance ways into public car parks should be treated as:
You are in the left-hand lane at traffic signals. You are waiting to turn left. At which of these traffic signals may you move on?
What is the maximum speed you may drive if you have a ‘space saver wheel’ fitted?
When a flock of sheep are coming towards you on a country road, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Sound the horn on your vehicle to move them out the way
Slow down or pull over to the side of the road
Turn on your vehicle hazard lights and drive on
Drive down the centre of the road

Question: What is the minimum tread depth required for car tyres?
Your vehicle has a current warrant of fitness but a rear red brake light (stop light) is not working. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Only use the vehicle during daylight hours
Only use the vehicle in a 50km/h speed zone

Question: You wish to make a right turn on a narrow country road. There is a vehicle coming towards you and traffic behind you. What is the safest option?

Answers.Answer: Wait in the centre of the road and turn when it is clear
Drive straight ahead and do a U-turn when the road is clear
Decide not to turn and drive straight ahead
Move to the left side of the road and turn when the road is clear

Answers.Answer: use the flush median strip and reverse back to the exit

Drive on because the signal will turn green
